main event: An unidentified object was reported observed over Minneapolis, MN in 1953. It appeared to be round, white, luminous, and changed color from white to yellow to green. It was estimated to be at an altitude of 3000 to 4000 feet and was visible for about 20 minutes before disappearing to the north. Photographs were taken but are not available.
interesting points: The sighting was made by two trained air force officers and was also observed by ground observers.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of approximately 1000 to 1200 m.p.h.
The objects climbed and descended rapidly, executing sharp turns.
Weather conditions at the time were reported as clear with no wind.
The report was investigated, and it was concluded that the object observed was a weather balloon launched from the Minneapolis area.
sighted object: round, white, luminous object changing color
photographs: photographs were taken but not available
